definition: perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
garment/jacket with open slits in place of sleeves

sentences.english: This undershirt is made of thin fabric.
sentences.chinese: 这件汗衫是薄布料制成的。

sentences.english: His vest has been left in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 他的汗衫遗留在了门厅。

sentences.english: I’m often unshaven, dressed in sweats, slouched at my desk.
sentences.chinese: 我常常不刮胡子，穿着汗衫，无精打采地坐在桌子上。

sentences.english: I always keep a clean t-shirt and socks in my gym bag.
sentences.chinese: 我总是在我的运动包里放一件干净的汗衫及短袜。

sentences.english: As the music beats, the shirts equalizer lights up to the beat of the music.
sentences.chinese: 随着音乐的不同节拍，汗衫上的均衡器就会随之亮起。

sentences.english: The getter up of two clubs will have a pair of skates, and a double breasted pink undershirt thrown in.
sentences.chinese: 装扮还应该还有一双滑雪板以及内附粉红双襟汗衫。

sentences.english: Dashan, what do you think of this orange sweatshirt?
sentences.chinese: 大山，你觉得这件橘黄色汗衫怎么样？

sentences.english: You can lose a job by wearing an undershirt or simply a little too much clothing.
sentences.chinese: 衣服多穿了一点点或穿了件汗衫让你失去一份工作。

definition: long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
